title: Export Metrics to Notion
excerpt: Export DataTools Pro metrics glossary to Notion with our direct API integration.
content_markdown:
![Notion export](https://datatoolspro.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/icons8-notion-250.png)

Export DataTools Pro metrics glossary to Notion with our direct API integration. This secured integration allows you to seamlessly push metrics definitions to business users making it accessible to Notion users.

Learn more about [DataTools Pro Metrics Glossary](https://datatoolspro.com/lesson/metrics-glossary-for-salesforce/ "Building Metrics Glossary for Salesforce with DataTools Pro")

Learn about other [DataTools Pro integrations](https://datatoolspro.com/integrations/ "DataTools Pro Integrations for Metrics Governance")

## Conenct DataTools Pro to Notion

Step 1: [Access Notion settings page](https://app.datatoolspro.com/user/notion "DataTools Pro Notion Settings")

Step 2: Click â€œConnect DataTols Pro to Notion

Step 2. Filter the metrics glossary contents that you would like to export

Step 3. Click the Notion icon to open the export dialogue

![](https://datatoolspro.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/image-10.png)

Step 4. Select the page that you would like to create and nest your metrics glossary.

Step 5. Open Notion to view your published metrics glossary.

## Notes on Updating your Metrics Glossary

Once you publish your Metrics Glossary, DataTools pro will keep a list of all pages you have published but will not automatically update Notion as you update your metrics. You will need to re-publish to post updates to users in Notion.
